intro: Myrrhis nodosa, commonly known as nodding sweetflag, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features hollow, cylindrical stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Myrrhis nodosa is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
